intro: Ribes oxyacanthoides subsp. irriguum, commonly known as the Sierra gooseberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that ripen in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and streamside areas. Its botanical features include elliptical leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white flowers.
